candidates.title: Bump openssl from 0.10.71 to 0.10.72

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust

candidates.body:
Bumps [openssl](https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl) from 0.10.71 to 0.10.72.
Release notes

Sourced from openssl's releases.

openssl-v0.10.72

What's Changed

  • make set_rsa_oaep_md visible to boringssl config by @​frncs-rss in sfackler/rust-openssl#2372
  • Fix typo in openssl-sys build script by @​rushilmehra in sfackler/rust-openssl#2375
  • Unify the two BoringSSL codepaths a bit and simplify init by @​davidben in sfackler/rust-openssl#2377
  • pkey_ctx: Fix link to the corresponding OpenSSL function by @​Jakuje in sfackler/rust-openssl#2378
  • fix test on MSRV by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#2383
  • Add support for AWS-LC to openssl and openssl-sys crates by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#1805
  • Enable additional capabilities for AWS-LC by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#2386
  • Use --experimental with bindgen-cli with aws-lc build by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#2389
  • Fixed two UAFs and bumped versions for release by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#2390

New Contributors

  • @​Jakuje made their first contribution in sfackler/rust-openssl#2378
  • @​skmcgrail made their first contribution in sfackler/rust-openssl#1805

Full Changelog: https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl/compare/openssl-v0.10.71...openssl-v0.10.72

Commits
  • 87085bd Merge pull request #2390 from alex/uaf-fix
  • d1a12e2 Fixed two UAFs and bumped versions for release
  • 7c7b2e6 Merge pull request #2389 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-follow-up
  • 34a477b Use --experimental with bindgen-cli with aws-lc build
  • d4bf071 Merge pull request #2386 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-follow-up
  • a86bf67 Remove comment
  • 705dbfb Fix test
  • e0df413 Skip final call for LibreSSL 4.1.0 for CCM mode
  • 2f1164b Enable additional capabilities for AWS-LC
  • dde9ffb Merge pull request #1805 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-support-final
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Move shared dependencies to workspace Cargo.toml.
Update reqwest for fda.
candidates.body:
This hopefully fixes sporadic failures in the qa repo, given https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/2507

Also ensure we can override the log-level for the binary using env variable.

candidates.title: [adapters] Make sure Kafka input connectors have unique group IDs.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: connectors
labels.description: Issues related to the adapters/connectors crate

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Every non-FT Kafka input connector needs a unique `group.id`.  Until now, uniqueness was ensured by using a timestamp in milliseconds.  Until commit d6d512e86ebf ("[adapters] Initialize connectors concurrently."), the connectors were initialized one-by-one.  Initialization took multiple milliseconds, at least, because it required a round trip to the broker. After that commit, though, the early phase of initialization that assigned `group.id` happened concurrently, so it was possible to get duplicate timestamps and therefore duplicate `group.id`s.

This commit fixes the problem by using a UUID instead.

With this commit, it might be possible to revert commit d047940fc161 ("[adapters] Serialize Kafka adapter initialization.").

Thanks to Simon Kassing for reporting the bug.

candidates.title: [adapters] Remove cmake dependency for rdkafka.

labels.name: connectors
labels.description: Issues related to the adapters/connectors crate

candidates.body:
Building Kafka with cmake started causing issues recently (most likely due to pip installing cmake 4.0 and this issue: https://github.com/confluentinc/librdkafka/issues/4594#issuecomment-2765371512)

This feature should only be needed on Windows, which we don't support anyway, so this commit removes it.  Hopefully this will make rdkafka builds less fragile in the future.

candidates.title: [adapters] Improve deserialize_table_record.

labels.name: connectors
labels.description: Issues related to the adapters/connectors crate

candidates.body:
The `deserialize_table_record` macro generated Rust code that compiled very slowly. This commit improves compilation times significantly by breaking the code up into smaller functions and shoving dynamic dispatch down compiler's throat.

* Invoke `deserialize` for individual fields via dynamic dispatch, thus preventing these functions from getting inlined.

* Convert generared `visit_map` and `visit_seq` into loops.

* Use a static HashMap for field name lookups. This can potentially speed up the parsing of records with many fields, but I haven't run any benchmarks.

I've been testing this on a program that consists of ~10 tables with ~90 columns each. It reduces the number of generated LLVM code by ~30% and compilation time by approximately 2.5x (which shows that the compiler doesn't like large functions, so in the future we may want to focus our optimizations on those).

TODOs:
* We can do the same for serialization functions, which are less terrible that deserialization, but can still benefit from the same optimizations.

candidates.title: Add Arrow IPC format for ad-hoc queries.
candidates.body:
JSON is unable to represent some datatypes we support like MAP with non-string keys so the serialization to JSON fails (https://github.com/feldera/feldera/issues/3546).

This adds a new query format for arrow ipc to the backend and fda. Using this formats the queries also work for map types with non-string keys.

Also adds support for parquet format to fda which was previously missing.

candidates.title: pipeline-manager: refactor dependencies
candidates.body:
- Organize existing dependencies in the `[dependencies]` section
- Add the pipeline crate dependencies `compare` and `tikv-jemallocator` such they are part of `Cargo.lock`
- Have the SQL compiler multi-crate compilation use `tikv-jemallocator` defined in the workspace

candidates.title: Suspend

labels.name: ft
labels.description: Fault tolerant, distributed, and scale-out implementation

labels.name: API
labels.description: Distributed system APIs

labels.name: Pipeline manager
labels.description: Pipeline manager (API, API server, runner, compiler server)

labels.name: connectors
labels.description: Issues related to the adapters/connectors crate

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body: Add support for a "suspend" operation that checkpoints the pipeline and exits. Suspend works even without fault tolerance.

candidates.title: pipeline-manager: support multi-crate compilation
candidates.body:
The compiler server now passes the `--crates` argument to SQL compiler, causing it to generate multiple crates instead of a single `main.rs`.

This yields two main benefits:
- Partial (re)compilation: compile only the portions of the circuit which are affected and have not yet been compiled
- Faster compilation: the decomposition into multiple crates enables more parallelism in the cargo build process

Notable changes to the compiler server inner workings:
- The `main_rust` field now contains the base64-encoded gzipped archive of the directory of crates that the SQL compiler outputs
- Cleanup now also includes the `target/<target>/incremental` directory, which contains artifacts when building with the `dev` profile for which `<target>` is `debug`
- Source checksum no longer covers compiler argument paths, as they generally change only if the platform version changes, which is covered
- Compilation artifacts are now also kept of pipelines which are not (yet) successfully compiled, which prevents them from being cleaned up if there is a large Rust (re)compilation queue
- Compilation artifact retention is increased from 900s to 3600s, and the cleanup interval from 30s to 120s
- In terms of `rust-compilation` directory content:
  - Directories `projects` and `binaries` are no longer used and can be manually deleted
  - Directory `crates` is added, and is the directory where all crates used for compilation are kept
  - Directory `pipeline-binaries` has not changed, as such binaries from Rust compilations prior to this commit are still usable
  - Pipeline-related artifacts in `target` from Rust compilations prior to this commit are no longer detected during cleanup due to the different artifact naming. These artifacts can be manually deleted.
  - Cleanup state is now stored in `target_cleanup.json`. The prior cleanup state file `cleanup_state.json` can be manually deleted.

candidates.title: [adapters] Initialize connectors concurrently.

labels.name: connectors
labels.description: Issues related to the adapters/connectors crate

candidates.body:
Fixes #3663.

Use a thread pool to initialize multiple input/output connectors in parallel in order to reduce the startup time for circuits with many connectors that requires slow initialization (e.g., Delta).

candidates.title: Automate release in CI
candidates.body:
This provides a release action that does all the steps to release our software (currently still needs to be triggered manually, but if it works we can run this in nightly).

As opposed to updating the version with a commit before the release in the repo, we now set the versions to the next release after the release is done. This makes sure we can release a commit that passed the merge queue and has pre-built artifacts.

candidates.title: [dbsp] Remove io_uring storage backend.

labels.name: storage
labels.description: Persistence for internal state in DBSP operators

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body: This backend isn't usable as a public cloud container workload, because those environment disable io_uring.  In addition, even in environments where io_uring was available, the performance improvement was minimal. Probably, this is because we do not yet meaningfully overlap I/O, so maybe it would be worth revisiting sometime later, but for now let's drop io_uring since it is extra code to maintain without a clear benefit.

candidates.body: This fixes the problem that filters disappeared when restarting from a checkpoint with FT enabled.

chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [openssl](https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl) from 0.10.71 to 0.10.72.
Release notes

Sourced from openssl's releases.

openssl-v0.10.72

What's Changed

  • make set_rsa_oaep_md visible to boringssl config by @​frncs-rss in sfackler/rust-openssl#2372
  • Fix typo in openssl-sys build script by @​rushilmehra in sfackler/rust-openssl#2375
  • Unify the two BoringSSL codepaths a bit and simplify init by @​davidben in sfackler/rust-openssl#2377
  • pkey_ctx: Fix link to the corresponding OpenSSL function by @​Jakuje in sfackler/rust-openssl#2378
  • fix test on MSRV by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#2383
  • Add support for AWS-LC to openssl and openssl-sys crates by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#1805
  • Enable additional capabilities for AWS-LC by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#2386
  • Use --experimental with bindgen-cli with aws-lc build by @​skmcgrail in sfackler/rust-openssl#2389
  • Fixed two UAFs and bumped versions for release by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#2390

New Contributors

  • @​Jakuje made their first contribution in sfackler/rust-openssl#2378
  • @​skmcgrail made their first contribution in sfackler/rust-openssl#1805

Full Changelog: https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl/compare/openssl-v0.10.71...openssl-v0.10.72

Commits
  • 87085bd Merge pull request #2390 from alex/uaf-fix
  • d1a12e2 Fixed two UAFs and bumped versions for release
  • 7c7b2e6 Merge pull request #2389 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-follow-up
  • 34a477b Use --experimental with bindgen-cli with aws-lc build
  • d4bf071 Merge pull request #2386 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-follow-up
  • a86bf67 Remove comment
  • 705dbfb Fix test
  • e0df413 Skip final call for LibreSSL 4.1.0 for CCM mode
  • 2f1164b Enable additional capabilities for AWS-LC
  • dde9ffb Merge pull request #1805 from skmcgrail/aws-lc-support-final
